bill.title: Federal Benefits Fairness and Restoration Act of 2016

item.title: Federal Benefits Fairness and Restoration Act of 2016

To amend the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 to repeal the denial of assistance and benefits for individuals with certain drug-related convictions, and for other purposes.
Federal Benefits Fairness and Restoration Act of 2016

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 162, Number 144 (Thursday, September 22, 2016)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. WATSON COLEMAN:H.R. 6163.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, Clause 1 of the ConstitutionArticle 1, Section 8, Clause 18 of the Constitution____________________[Page H5866]

item.name: Introduced in House
item.text:
Federal Benefits Fairness and Restoration Act of 2016

This bill amends the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 to repeal the denial of assistance and benefits for certain drug-related convictions.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
